main event: An unidentified flying object (UFO) was observed in Moscow, Idaho on August 6, 1953. The object was described as disk-shaped and approximately 270 feet in size, emitting a pinkish color. It was observed to travel at a speed of 130 MPH and covered 500 miles in 24 minutes, making erratic movements against the horizon.
interesting points: The UFO was described as disk-shaped, measuring 270 feet in size, and emitting a pinkish color.
It traveled at a speed of 130 MPH and covered 500 miles in 24 minutes, making erratic movements against the horizon.
The observation was made by a crew of three individuals and occurred from August 5th, 2145 PST to August 5th, 2415 PST.
The sighting location was 40 degrees 50 minutes N latitude and 117 degrees W longitude, approximately 3 miles northwest of VA Grid DE 2342.
The report indicates that the object was very low, approximately 2 1/2 miles from the observer, and was observed in a clear sky with scattered clouds.
sighted object: Unidentified disk-shaped object emitting a pinkish color
